owl:Ontology.dc:title: Semantic Components Ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: This ontology extends OWL ontologies to annotate classes and properties with related semantic component display tools.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: cardinality
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment:
Number of values a property (datatype, object or annotation) can have when describing a specific record.
One example of th usage of this property is with structWSF that uses it to know if a property can have multiple values, and if it doesn't then it uses single-valued field in Solr.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: comparable with
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment:
Specify a "comparableWith" relation between two predicates. These comparable attributes have the same allowedValue(s), and the semantic of the predicates that are comparable is the same. Since the kind of value, and their semantic is the same, they are then considered comparable.
This is normally used to plot values of different attributes describing a same record on some visualization component (for example, a linear chart).

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: display control
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: Annotate a class or a property to reference it to a display control. This indicates what are the semantic components that can normally be used to display some information about a record of a certain type, or a record that is described using some property.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: ignored by
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: Specify if a property, class or named individual has to be ignored by a specific semantci component tool.
Specify if a property, class or named individual has to be ignored by a specific semantic component tool.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: maximal cardinality
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment:
Maximum number of values a property (datatype, object or annotation) can have when describing a specific record.
One example of th usage of this property is with structWSF that uses it to know if a property can have multiple values, and if it doesn't then it uses single-valued field in Solr.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: minimal cardinality
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment:
Minimal number of values a property (datatype, object or annotation) can have when describing a specific record.
One example of th usage of this property is with structWSF that uses it to know if a property can have multiple values, and if it doesn't then it uses single-valued field in Solr.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: ontology type
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: Specify what is the SCO type of an ontology.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: ordering value
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: The value of the orderingValue predicate is used to order the predicate of a set of comparable predicates. This set of comparable predicates is normally created from the set composed of all compatibleWith predicates. This is normally used to plot, and order, values of different attributes describing a same record on some visualization component (for example, a linear chart).

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: short label
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment: The short label is used to display a short version of the label of an attribute/type where it has to be displayed in a restrained region of a component.

owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:label: unit type
owl:AnnotationProperty.rdfs:comment:
URI reference to a unit type ontology. The sco:unitType property is used to determine the type of unit referenced by a property. For example, if a data property has xsd:float as range, then sco:unitType determine what kind of things this number refers to.
The semantic components will make all the properties that share the same sco:unitType comparable (so, possibly displayable on the same semantic component, such as the sBarChart and the sLinearChart).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: comparable with
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment:
Specify a "comparableWith" relation between two predicates. These comparable attributes have the same allowedValue(s), and the semantic of the predicates that are comparable is the same. Since the kind of value, and their semantic is the same, they are then considered comparable.
This is normally used to plot values of different attributes describing a same record on some visualization component (for example, a linear chart).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: display control
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Annotate a class or a property to reference it to a display control. This indicates what are the semantic components that can normally be used to display some information about a record of a certain type, or a record that is described using some property.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: ignored by
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specify if a property, class or named individual has to be ignored by a specific semantci component tool.
Specify if a property, class or named individual has to be ignored by a specific semantic component tool.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: relation browser node type
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Reference to a relation browser node type used to skin a node according to its type. This should be a reference to a type URI defined in a relation browse nodes skins configuration file. If a record is defined with this property, the relation browser will try to find a node of that type to apply to it as a skin.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: unit type
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment:
URI reference to a unit type ontology. The sco:unitType property is used to determine the type of unit referenced by a property. For example, if a data property has xsd:float as range, then sco:unitType determine what kind of things this number refers to.
The semantic components will make all the properties that share the same sco:unitType comparable (so, possibly displayable on the same semantic component, such as the sBarChart and the sLinearChart).

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: dashboard sessions file uri
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
URI reference to the Dashboard session accessible on the Web.
This is used by the sDashboard semantic component.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: geohash
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Defines the Geohash of a record's location.
More informationa bout Geohash: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geohash

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: gis map
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Reference a map binary file created created from a ShapeFile map file and ClearMapsBuilder. The referenced map file is a serialized ActionalScript object.
The sco:gisMap defines the first layout that is related to a given resource. Normally, this resource is part of the map related by the gisMap predicate. Read more about maps in the sMap documentation page.
There is only one gisMap relationship per resource, other relationships should be made with the sco:relatedGisMap predicate.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: map level
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Specify a map geographic level comparable to a latitude where the record is better displayed on a geographic map. This value is generally an integer between 0 and 21 where 0 is the entire World, and 21 the level used to visualize building details. This is generally used to the Google Map's zooming level.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: map marker image url
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URL of an icon image to use as a marker on a web map. Normally, this property is used to annotate a Class description. All the records belonging to that class will be marked on a map, using this icon image.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: named entity
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Specifies if a resource can be considered a named entity.
Literal value: "true" or "false"

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: ordering value
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The value of the orderingValue predicate is used to order the predicate of a set of comparable predicates. This set of comparable predicates is normally created from the set composed of all compatibleWith predicates. This is normally used to plot, and order, values of different attributes describing a same record on some visualization component (for example, a linear chart).

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: polygon coordinates
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Defines the coordinates of a polygon shape that represent a geographic area determined by a record.
Coordinates are defined as coordinates in KML: http://code.google.com/apis/kml/documentation/kmlreference.html#coordinates

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: polyline coordinates
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Defines the coordinates of a polyline shape that represents a record on a map.
Coordinates are defined as coordinates in KML: http://code.google.com/apis/kml/documentation/kmlreference.html#coordinates

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: related gis map
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Reference a map binary file created created from a ShapeFile map file and ClearMapsBuilder. The referenced map file is a serialized ActionalScript object.
The sco:relatedGisMap defines a related map layout that is related to a given resource. The resource is related to that map layer in some ways, but it is not necessary part of the layer. Read more about maps in the sMap documentation page.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: short label
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: The short label is used to display a short version of the label of an attribute/type where it has to be displayed in a restrained region of a component.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: story annotated text uri
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URI Reference to the annotated text of a story. Annotations are serialized in XML given the GATE format.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: story text uri
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URI reference to the text of a story

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: story URL
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: URL reference to a webpage representation of the story that got indexed into Scones.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: component
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Semantic Component tool that is used to display structured data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ontology type
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A loosely defined type for an ontology. These types are used to loosely categorize ontologies by some kind of types.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: administrative ontology
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Ontology normally used by systems for administrative purposes such as defining using permissions, tool behaviors, dataset descriptions, etc.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: local ontology
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Ontology used to describe the things in relation to a Open Semantic Framework (OSF) instance. These ontologies normally defines all the classes and properties not defined in any reference ontologies that need to be defined in one of these OSF instances.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: reference ontology
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Ontology that are normally used by a wide range of people and organization to define common entities such as People, Books, etc. Such ontologies could be FOAF, BIBO, DCTERMS, UMBEL, etc.
